Package com.example.Bank.Controllers.Imp

Class AuthControllerImp

java.lang.Object
com.example.Bank.Controllers.Imp.AuthControllerImp
All Implemented Interfaces:
AuthController
@RequestMapping("api/v1/users") @RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:8081") public class AuthControllerImp extends Object implements AuthController
Implementation of the AuthController interface for handling authentication-related endpoints. This class implements the AuthController interface and provides implementations for handling authentication-related endpoints such as login, registration, and user authentication.
Author:
Pedro Pereira

  • Method Details

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<JWTResponse> login(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid ContractAndPasswordRequest contractAndPasswordRequest)
      Handle user login. This method handles the login endpoint. It takes an EmailAndPasswordRequest object containing the user's email and password, validates it, and returns a JWTResponse containing the authentication token.
      Specified by:
      login in interface AuthController
      Parameters:
      contractAndPasswordRequest - The request containing user contract and password.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the JWTResponse with the authentication token.

    • registation

      @PostMapping("/registation") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CreateAccountResponse> registation(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid CreateAccount createAccount)
      Handle user registration. This method handles the registration endpoint. It takes a CreateAccount object containing the user's registration information, validates it, creates a new account, and returns a CreateAccountResponse with the details of the created account.
      Specified by:
      registation in interface AuthController
      Parameters:
      createAccount - The request containing user registration information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the CreateAccountResponse with the details of the created account.

    • auth

      @PostMapping("/auth") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AccoutResponse> auth(@AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.oauth2.jwt.Jwt jwt)
      Handle user authentication. This method handles the authentication endpoint. It takes a JWT object containing the authentication token, verifies it, and returns details of the authenticated user's account.
      Specified by:
      auth in interface AuthController
      Parameters:
      jwt - The JWT token containing authentication information.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the AccoutResponse with details of the authenticated user's account.
